title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 16 June 2015 - XWiki

11:17 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
11:21 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
11:40 <woshilapin> Hi, I have a little question about 'anchor' in the XWiki Syntax  
11:40 <woshilapin> It seems that soem parameters are encoded  
11:41 <woshilapin> For example  
11:41 <woshilapin> [[the documentation>>platform:DevGuide.Standard URL Format||anchor="HParameter:objectPolicy"]]  
11:41 <woshilapin> The 'column' is encoded  
11:41 <woshilapin> But it shouldn't  
11:42 <vmassol> Hi woshilapin  
11:42 <vmassol> what coumn?  
11:42 <vmassol> \*column  
11:42 <woshilapin> Because the real page works with ':', not %3A  
11:42 <woshilapin> In fact, I'm not completely sure of what is happening  
11:43 <woshilapin> Because, hovering the link with my mouse, the character is still ':' (this column)  
11:43 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:44 <woshilapin> So, is OK, forget about it, I think I just reached a temporary error, I can't reproduce...  
11:44 <woshilapin> Both http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Standard+URL+Format#HParameter%3AobjectPolicy and http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Standard+URL+Format#HParameter:objectPolicy are rachable  
11:44 <woshilapin> reachable\*  
11:45 <woshilapin> @vincent: It seems that this morning is the morning when I lose your time, sorry ;-)  
11:46 <vmassol> hehe :)  
11:46 <vmassol> no worries  
11:47 <vmassol> btw tmortagne and others I had somethgin really strange re anchros yesterday  
11:47 <vmassol> and I don't understand it  
11:47 <vmassol> if you check this page: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/How+can+I+navigate+to+a+given+page  
11:47 <vmassol> if you edit it you'll see it has plenty of anchors  
11:47 <tmortagne> woshilapin: : is supposed to be encoded in a URL, the server probably receive the same things (%3A) it's just your browser allowing you to put :  
11:47 <vmassol> but when rendered they're not there  
11:47 <vmassol> and if I add the same link at the top before the list it's rendered ok  
11:47 <vmassol> any idea?  
11:48 <tmortagne> hmm I had the issue this morning but only temporary on http://test.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Performances/Jetty+HSQLDB+single+wiki+644+to+71, I tough it was an issue with my macro  
11:48 <vmassol> here it's not temporary it always happen  
11:49 <vmassol> so before debugging the rendering I wanted to make sure if it was not me missing something… ;)  
11:49 <tmortagne>    testing something in your page  
11:49 <vmassol> ok  
11:50 <tmortagne> hmm  
11:50 <tmortagne> look at the diff  
11:50 <tmortagne> looks like the 2.0 parser is used for this page for some reason  
11:50 <vmassol> so a problem of parser  
11:50 <tmortagne> maybe it's because of the sheet  
11:50 <tmortagne> no  
11:50 <vmassol> yes probably  
11:50 <tmortagne> I don't think it's a prser bug  
11:50 <tmortagne> I thins the wrong one is used  
11:51 <vmassol> no I meant a problme of veresion of the wiki syntax parsr used  
11:51 <tmortagne> need to check exactly how the sheet display the field  
11:51 <vmassol> (sorry my fingers are still not answering to my will and I make lot of typos ;))  
11:51 <tmortagne> maybe it put the field content directly in its content instead of using the displayer or something like this  
11:52 <cjd> You're typing 2-handed already ?  
11:52 <vmassol> not quite, more like 1.5 hands  
11:52 <cjd> be careful  
11:52 <vmassol> had the splint removed this morning but I can't control 2 fingers  
11:52 <cjd> but it sounds like you are  
11:52 <vmassol> need 20 sessions of reeducation now  
11:52 <tmortagne> (which is both wrong and dangerous since all FAQ pages are executed with the sheet author rights)  
11:55 <vmassol> fixing the page for now, I'll report an issue  
11:57 <tmortagne> vmassol: that's it FAQSheet copy/paste directly the value of the field answer (but put it in $doc.fullName {{context}} so at least from security point of view that should be ok)  
11:58 <tmortagne> there is no comment to explain why it's doing that  
11:58 <vmassol> tmortagne: so you're saying the pb is in the FAQ app and not a generic pb of display module?  
11:58 <tmortagne> yes it's a FAQ app bug  
11:58 <tmortagne> it's taking the value and paste it as if it was sheet content  
11:59 <vmassol> I put a comment there  
11:59 <tmortagne> so of course it's using sheet syntax  
11:59 <vmassol> actually Anca wrote most of it  
12:00 <vmassol> the reason I put for {{context}} was just " ## Make sure to resolve reference based on the right document"  
12:00 <tmortagne> it would be propery resolved if it was using the displayer in the first place  
12:01 <tmortagne> s/propery/properly/  
12:01 <vmassol> yes I dont know why I did it like this, there must have been a reason( possibly a bad one)  
12:04 <vmassol> XWIKI-12200  
12:04 <vmassol> (lunch time)  
13:12 <vmassol> hmm trying to debug "Caused by: org.hibernate.DuplicateMappingException: Duplicate query mapping getSpaceDocsName" when running func tests  
13:14 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:15 <msmeria1> has quit  
13:31 <vmassol> need to understand why initialize() is called several times in HqlQueryExecutor  
13:31 <vmassol> debugging...  
14:08 <vmassol> btw platform build fails because of "Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class org.apache.xerces.impl.xs.XMLSchemaValidator"  
14:09 <vmassol> hmm actually could be the problme I have locally

15:32 <gdelhumeau> I propose to upgrade myxwiki.org  
15:32 <gdelhumeau> to 7.1  
15:34 <gdelhumeau> any objection?  
15:50 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: +1  
15:58 <vmassol> big +1

16:26 <vmassol> thanks

19:22 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> has joined #xwiki  
19:28 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> Hi. Is there a way to make the XWiki space in a particular wiki not appear on the navigation panel?  
19:33 <tmortagne> xwikiorg\_guest\_7: for a space to be hidden all the documents it contains should be hidden (when you edit a document to can make it "hidden" on the right)
